node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: In today's sports news - England announce game against All Blacks, Covid-19's impact on European sport grows, and Hamilton's gets knighted.

node.title: Fox News Hosts Take the Offensive About Texts to Meadows
node.description: Stars of the most-watched cable channel continued to downplay the Jan. 6 attack and back Donald J. Trump while criticizing the investigation of the Capitol siege.

node.title: 62 Percent of Older Americans Have Used Telehealth During Pandemic, but Concerns Remain
node.description: A new poll showed most respondents were comfortable with telehealth, though they were still concerned about technology issues and receiving adequate care.

node.title: Kentucky Towns Devastated by Recent Tornadoes Can Learn From Recovery of Greensburg, Kansas
node.description: A continuing rebuild has turned Greensburg into one of the nation's greenest cities.

node.title: Paedophile who abused own family for 29 years avoids four possible life sentences
node.description: A Hunter Valley man who pleaded guilty to sexually abusing his sister, daughter, nieces and two other children will not be eligible for parole until he is 71.

node.title: Children fall 10 metres from jumping castle blown into air at Tasmanian school
node.description: Several children have fallen from a height of 10 metres, causing serious injuries, after wind blew a jumping castle into the air at a primary school in Tasmania's north-west.

node.title: 'I was suspicious, so I dug a bit deeper' - Translator raises alarm about fraudulent vaccine exemption
node.description: Foreign nationals could be using fraudulent vaccine exemptions to get out of having a jab before entering the country - and there are worries health authorities might not be awake to the problem.

node.title: COVID-19 again upends college life as campuses shut down
node.description: "This is not quite how we expected to end the semester," officials at one schools said as infections surge.

node.title: Dutch Lawmaker Thierry Baudet Ordered to Remove Tweets Comparing Unvaccinated to Jews
node.description: Baudet must take down the tweets within 48 hours or face a fine of €25,000 a day until they're deleted.

node.title: Freight Train Companies Testing Hydrogen-, Battery-Powered Locomotives to Cut Emissions
node.description: All railroads cautioned that at this stage, they are only pilot tests, and new options won't be ready to replace diesel locomotives for several years at least.

node.title: Tesla defends Model 37 taxi after fatal accident in Paris
node.description: Paris taxi company G7 suspends the use of the 37 Model 3 cars in its fleet after an accident in which one person was killed and 20 injured.

node.title: Seafood sector report recommends more formal industry training
node.description: An inquiry into the seafood sector's workforce has recommended a raft of changes to reduce its reliance on migrant workers.

node.title: Sky TV sells Mt Wellington campus for $56m
node.description: Sky Network Television has sold its Mt Wellington properties for $56 million to Goodman Property Trust. Sky Network Television has sold its Mt Wellington properties for $56 million to Goodman...

node.title: US House passes measure clamping down on products from China's Xinjiang
node.description: The US House of Representatives passed legislation on Tuesday to ban imports from China's Xinjiang region over concerns about forced labor, part of Washington's continued pushback against Beijing's…

node.title: Nearly 12% of those charged in the Jan. 6 probe have military ties
node.description: At least 81 of the more than 700 individuals accused of participating in the Capitol attack are current or former service members.

node.title: Landlord Accused of Demanding Sex From Tenants to Pay $4.5 Million
node.description: A federal civil rights suit had accused Joseph Centanni of demanding sexual acts from tenants in Elizabeth, N.J. He denied wrongdoing, but agreed to pay.

node.title: ‘Selling Kabul’ Holds Up a New Mirror After the Taliban Takeover
node.description: Sylvia Khoury’s play, which takes place over one night in Afghanistan in 2013, has only deepened after a pandemic postponement.

node.title: 98 Conservative Lawmakers Oppose Boris Johnson, Vote Against COVID Vaccine Passports
node.description: Opposition support was able to successfully pass Johnson's measure, which requires people to show vaccine passports to enter nightclubs and other venues.

node.title: Caroline Kennedy, Michelle Kwan Nominated for U.S. Ambassadorships
node.description: President Joe Biden nominated Kennedy to serve as ambassador to Australia, and Kwan to serve as ambassador to Belize.

node.title: Federal Reserve Readies to Take Rapid Steps With Interest Rates in 2022 to Fight Inflation
node.description: The Federal Reserve could increase interest rates as early as the first half of 2022 due to withdrawing monthly bond purchases at twice the speed it announced.

node.title: Mainfreight investigation reveals logbook, work time breaches
node.description: An investigation into one of the country's largest freight companies has found drivers felt forced into falsifying their logbooks and ditched mandatory rest times in order to make their runs on time.

node.title: Cricket South Africa reviews independant report on discrimination
node.description: Cricket South Africa (CSA) will review recommendations made in the final report of an independent ombudsman "with an open mind" after allegations the organisation had previously discriminated against…

node.title: NZ Open to go ahead with places at British Open on the line
node.description: Next year's New Zealand golf Open will go ahead.

node.title: Torrential rain causes flooding, evacuations and road closures
node.description: Christchurch had more rain in one day yesterday than it usually has in one month. Audio

node.title: Abdul Aziz awarded highest bravery accolade: 'This shows that people are with us'
node.description: Abdul Aziz, who chased away the terrorist who attacked Linwood Islamic Centre and Al Noor Mosque, has been given the country's highest bravery award. Audio

node.title: Overall health spending in the U.S. reached record levels in 2020.
node.description: A new report says the amount spent jumped to 19.7 percent of the economy in 2020 from 9.7 percent in 2019, while direct spending on medical care declined.

node.title: New Studies Raise Hopes That Vaccines Prevent Severe Disease From Omicron
node.description: In the lab, immune cells put up a strong fight against Omicron, suggesting that vaccines will be able to prevent the worst outcomes of the virus variant.

node.title: 80,000 Honey Bees Found in Wall of Shower (Also, 100 Pounds of Honey)
node.description: “They were nice bees,” a St. Petersburg, Fla., homeowner said, but a bathroom renovation meant they had to go. A beekeeper safely removed them.

node.title: 'SNL': People Are Living for Viral Billie Eilish Hotel Ad Sketch With Kate McKinnon
node.description: "As someone in a limited-service hotel, this is embarrassingly accurate," one commenter pointed out.

node.title: Planned Parenthood Affiliate CEO Chris Charbonneau Ousted After Repeating Racist Language
node.description: "If I had to do it over again, I would not have used that actual term," said Charbonneau, who was removed after 40 years at the affiliate.
